answers.answer: Hi,How are you?There can be many causes of tingling numbness like peripheral neuropathy like diabetes, B12 deficiency, and nerve compression due to disc herniation, migraine, fibromyalgia and MS.It is very difficult to tell if it was a result of the brain surgery that you underwent. I would suggest you to take B12 supplements and see if it improves your symptoms.Take care!

question: In September of 2007 I had a brain surgery for meningioma I get tingling & numbness with shaking sometimes what should I do
title: brain surgery
